alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Pawnee; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 12:03AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Osage, northeastern Creek, southeastern Pawnee and Tulsa Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1203 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Walnut Creek State Park to 5 miles northeast of Bristow. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and dime to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Owasso... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Mannford... Kiefer... Sperry... Kellyville... Westport... Keystone State Park... Walnut Creek State Park... Jenks Riverside Airport... Turley... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 193 and 232. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
